meanings.definition: The end of a hammer head opposite the face, typically wedge-shaped for bending or shaping metal.
meanings.sent1: The peen of the hammer is used to shape metal.
meanings.sent2: He carefully used the peen to bend the metal into place.
meanings.sent3: The blacksmith's favorite tool was the peen for crafting intricate designs.
meanings.sent4: Her words hit him like a peen on metal, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The sharp peen of the hammer left a distinct mark on the metal.

meanings.definition: To strike with a hammer or other tool, especially the peen.
meanings.sent1: He will peen the metal to create a unique design.
meanings.sent2: She peened the nail into the wood with precision.
meanings.sent3: The sculptor decided to peen the marble block gently.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops peened against the window like tiny hammers.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of peening echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: A tool used for peening metal.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith reached for the peen to shape the metal.
meanings.sent2: She carefully selected the right peen for the job.
meanings.sent3: The shiny peen gleamed under the workshop lights.
meanings.sent4: The peen in his hand felt sturdy and reliable.
meanings.sent5: The old peen had seen years of hard work and craftsmanship.
